greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1) = 1; for n>1, if A241917(n) = 0 [i.e., n is a term of A070003], a(n) = A052126(n), otherwise a(n) = A252462(n).
comment: If the exponent of the largest prime dividing n is larger than one, subtract one from that exponent. Otherwise, shift that "lonely largest prime" one step towards smaller primes.
For any number n >= 2 in binary trees A253563 and A253565, a(n) gives the number which is the parent of n.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: a(1) = 1; for n>1, if A241917(n) = 0 [i.e., n is a term of A070003], a(n) = A052126(n), otherwise a(n) = A252462(n).
program: (PARI) A253553(n) = if(n<=2,1,my(f=factor(n), k=#f~); if(f[k,2]>1,f[k,2]--,f[k,1] = precprime(f[k,1]-1)); factorback(f)); \\ _Antti Karttunen_, Jul 17 2020
xref: Cf. A252464 (the number of iterations of n -> a(n) needed to reach 1 from n.)
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jan 12 2015
